Package the_game

Class LivingEntity

java.lang.Object
the_game.Entity
the_game.VisibleEntity
the_game.LivingEntity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Boss, Enemy, Hero
public class LivingEntity extends VisibleEntity
The class which represent any entity that can be defeated in the game.
Author:
Camille Girodengo

    • verifyDirection

      public EntityIdentity verifyDirection(char direction, Wall[] walls, Chest[] chests)
      Verify if there is a wall, a chest or if the space is clear right next to the living entity in the given direction
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to check
      walls - a Wall array which contains the location of all walls of the map except the borders.
      chests - a Chest array which contains the location of all the chests of the map
      Returns:
      • (new Wall(), index in the Wall array) if there is a wall that is not a border
      • (new Wall(), -1) if there is a wall border
      • (a Chest, its index in the chest array) if there is a chest
      • ("None", -1) if there is nothing

    • verifySuroundings

      public EntityIdentity[] verifySuroundings(Wall[] walls, Chest[] chests)
      Verify what is around the living entity in all four directions (up, right, down, left)
      Parameters:
      walls - an array of int arrays which contains the location of all walls of the map except the borders.
      chests - a Chest array which contains the location of all the chests of the map
      Returns:
      a String array. String[0] is for the direction "up", String[1] is for the direction "right", String[2] is for the direction "down", and String[3] is for the direction "left". Each equals either "Wall", "Chest" or "Clear"
      See Also:
      • invalid @see 
        #verifyDirection(char, int[][], Chest[])

    • move

      public void move(char direction)
      Void to move on the map
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which the living entity must move
